      Music
      Tyler, The Creator to Visit UCSB
      February 15, 2018 by William Emmons

      Multi-talented artist Tyler, The Creator is slated to visit Campbell Hall on March 9 to take part in a conversation with AS Program Board. The rapper is coming off a wave of buzz after releasing his latest studio album, Flower Boy last summer. 

      Tyler’s latest work has deviated somewhat from his past, taking a warm, candid approach with songs like “See You Again” and “Boredom” all while satisfying the darker, harder sound his fan base initially grew to love with cuts like “Who Dat Boy.” And in a few weeks, the musician is coming to campus to shed light on the inner workings of his music and creative endeavors. 

      You can stream a conversation Tyler, The Creator had with Jerrod Charmichael here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WrcwcMIYpQg 

      Tickets for UCSB students go on sale Friday, February 16 at 10:00 am for $20. General tickets go on sale Wednesday, February 21 for $25. 

      Print
      William Emmons

      Will is an Artsweek Editor. In his free time he enjoys listening to Death Grips and having heated discussions about the legitimacy of astrology.
